name: biomni-segment-and-analyze-microbial-cells
title: Biomni: Segment And Analyze Microbial Cells
description: Segment and analyze microbial cells in microscopy images using image processing techniques
content:
Overview

Segments and analyzes individual microbial cells in microscopy images using advanced image processing and computer vision techniques. This tool automatically identifies cell boundaries, extracts morphological features, and quantifies cellular characteristics such as size, shape, and spatial distribution. Essential for high-throughput phenotypic analysis and quantitative microscopy studies of bacterial populations.

Input Parameters

  • image_path (required): Path to the microscopy image file (phase contrast, brightfield, or fluorescence microscopy)
  • output_dir (optional, default: './output'): Directory for saving segmented images and analysis results
  • min_cell_size (optional, default: 50): Minimum cell area in pixels to exclude debris and artifacts
  • max_cell_size (optional, default: 5000): Maximum cell area in pixels to exclude clumps and aggregates

Input Format

{
  "image_path": "/path/to/microscopy_image.tif",
  "output_dir": "./cell_analysis_results",
  "min_cell_size": 100,
  "max_cell_size": 3000
}

Biological Use Case

Valuable for microbiology research including:

  • Single-cell morphology analysis and phenotypic heterogeneity studies
  • Cell size and shape distribution in bacterial populations
  • Quantification of cell division and growth patterns
  • Time-lapse microscopy analysis of bacterial growth
  • Antibiotic-induced morphological changes assessment
  • Bacterial cell cycle analysis and filamentation studies
  • Quality control in microscopy-based assays

Output

Generates comprehensive cell analysis including:

  • Segmented image with individual cells labeled and outlined
  • Cell count and density measurements
  • Morphological parameters (area, perimeter, circularity, aspect ratio)
  • Cell size distribution histograms
  • Spatial distribution analysis (nearest neighbor distances)
  • Statistical summary of cellular features
  • Detailed results report (cell_segmentation_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
